name: Carberry Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I decided to have a cheap getaway using the Groupon voucher, for the price we paid we didnt expect much but we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Peaceful calm weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by nice staff and shown to our room - which was very spacious, very clean, cosy and the bathroom was fantastic - we never have a bath in hotels but this was a must, it was so spacious and relaxing.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: the only thing which my husband was disappointed with was there was no TV in the room. This doesnt bother me at all, but he likes to have it on in the background.
reviews.title: Wondeful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was included and was to perfection - beautifully laid out, clean and good selection of food.
reviews.title: super hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fantastic, you are able to walk around and explore the rooms, the old librarys and piano rooms etc... gardens are huge - nice to walk around.
reviews.title: A place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend booked this hotel for a Christmas present, and it is quite honestly the most beautiful hotel I have ever seen. He upgraded our room, which we had for two nights, and we were so impressed - for two people, there was a very large bed (useful, as we usually encroach on each others' space!!) and at least 8 chairs, whilst the room remained totally uncluttered. My boyfriend, who never has a bath (preferring the shower), had two baths in two days as it was so luxurious and relaxing.
reviews.title: The Perfect Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the hotel on our fiirst evening which, despite being fairly pricey, was absolutely delicious, and breakfast each morning was well prepared and much appreciated! The staff work very hard to make sure all of your needs are attended to.
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxing stay in luxury surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you so much for a wonderful getaway - we hope to stay with you again soon!
reviews.title: Beautifully refurbished in late 2011, lovely place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights on a groupon voucher but we paid extra to upgrade to a superior room due to a personal celebration. Our room had its own turret where we could take tea and look out onto the grounds. The room was huge and we were lucky enough to have a TV in our room (i dont think everyone did) - although we hardly watched it! The bed was comfy; the overall room was very clean and well presented. The staff were so friendly and went out of their way to help and be hospitable. Food was lovely - we ate in the bar at night and had breakfast. Gardens were lovely and we enjoyed a walk through the woods - spotting some wild deer as we went. Would definately recommend as a place to stay.
reviews.title: Baronial Grandieur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at Carberry Tower when visiting the area. We got a brilliant deal on GroupOn but it would have been worth paying more to stay here.
reviews.title: Wonderful Country House in an amazing setting with magnificent views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: From the moment you drive through the grand arched entrance with accompanying gate house and see the historic Tower at the end of it's extensive private drive you know you're in for a treat. Truly Carberry Tower has an eclectic quality that bursts forward from the architecture, interior and landscaping. To say it blends in seamlessly with the local surroundings would be a rather subdued way to describe Carberrys influence on the area. The history that the Tower is steeped in is so rich and immersed that it is hard for me to see it as anything other than an incredibly important and awe inspiring feature of Scottish History.
reviews.title: Quintessential Scottish hospitality at it's very best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Carberry Tower for 7 days from the 5th of December onwards whilst waiting to move into a flat in Edinburgh. Originally I had only booked 2 nights but extended the stay to a week due, in part, to how welcome the staff made me feel. It was easy for me to work without distractions in the Tower and to get into Edinburgh and back. The whole place really felt like a home away from home, and I must say since moving into my flat all I want to do is go back.
reviews.title: True country house 15 minutes from Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Douglas and his team did a marvelous job in going far beyond the reasonable measure of service required time and time again. I had previously only ever experienced a team so dedicated to the comfort of there guests in Thailand. And even after spending a whole week at the Tower I couldn't find a single thing I didn't like or could fault.
reviews.title: Amazing, peaceful and relaxing place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Tower is under fairly new management and is currently, and will be continuing to be, undergoing quite considerable upgrades to ensure it can obtain the star rating it thoroughly deserves. This however did not effect my stay at all, in fact I barely noticed and only did due to my own personal interest in what was going on. Due to the misleading star rating system, (which I cannot understand as to why Carberry is only given 3?) I was thrilled to be able to stay there for what should be considered a fraction of it's true worth and can't wait to go back once they're satisfied that the Tower has become an incredibly luxurious and amazing scottish retreat.
reviews.title: Historic Carberry Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are some great walks in the area which the lovely ladies at the front/concierge desk will help you find. They'll also answer any questions you have on restaurants, shops and activities in the local area, as well as train times and the best methods for getting into Edinburgh. I know this as I asked them hundreds of testing questions that they never failed to answer, and always with a smile.
reviews.title: Mini Break at Carberry Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds and hotel are magnificent with beautiful lounges and excellent library which contains 10's of thousands of books of all kinds. The managers and staff were efficient without being stuffy and very friendly at all times. The restaurant and food were also excellent. I suspect that it will be very in future!popular with guests who have stayed before. It will be our 1st choice for Edinburgh
reviews.title: Faultless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant stay! Genuinely couldn't fault a thing. The hotel itself is beautiful, as are the surroundings. Our room was spacious and our bed comfortable. The food we ate in the retaurant, both at breakfast and on our first evening, was first class. The main reason it was so enjoyable though was the exemplary attitude of every member of staff working at Carberry Tower. All involved helped to make this a truly unforgettable stay. Thank you!
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived here mid jan for one night, we upgraded our room, glad i did as we stayed in what seemed the better end of the hotel. the room was lovely with a lovely bathroom up some little stairs inside our room. cant fault anything during our stay. the hotel is set in very pretty gardens and inside the hotel its self lots of rooms to explore all of which were lovely! the hotel was full yet we hardly saw anyone was lovely and quiet just what we were looking for. the staff were very helpful and very pleasent. they made us feel very welcome. overall we had a brilliant stay here and we will be returning.
reviews.title: brilliant stay! couldn't fault a thing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked this for my birthday and managed to get the suite with the four poster bed. Amazing room and the bathroom has to be the best I have ever seen. The whole building is fantastic and I couldn't stop looking around me wherever we were. The food and service in the restaurant was second to none, thank you to all the staff who looked after us. The bar is well stocked with a variety of whiskies and if this is your choice of drink then I am sure you will fine something to your taste.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only live a couple of miles away, however never usually visit places that are on our door-step and are delighted we decided to try Carberry Tower.
reviews.title: Excellent weekend break

description: This 15th-Century Castle dates back to Mary, Queen of Scots, and is set in 35 acres of stunning parkland. Edinburgh city centre is 8 miles from Carberry Tower and the nearest train station is located at Wallyford, which is a 5 minute car journey away. Rooms at the magnificent Carberry Tower are elegant and luxurious, providing exceptional comfort and stunning views of your surroundings. With beds that you can melt into, luxury Egyptian cotton linen and toiletries by Asprey - it really is your very own Castle retreat! There are a variety of natural features, including rose garden, a lily pond, manicured grounds and you can often see free-roaming wildlife. The Tower still retains charming old staircases, fireplaces, and stained-glass windows. Guests can dine in the Rose Garden Restaurant and enjoy a four course menu designed by Head Chef, commencing with canapes and a welcome drinks reception. Private dining for 2 or banquets can also be arranged.
